symptoms.name: Parotitis
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be unilateral or bilateral
symptoms.pattern: Typically follows a prodrome of fever, malaise, headache, myalgia, and anorexia

symptoms.name: Nephritis
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be fatal in rare cases
symptoms.pattern: May occur as a rare complication of mumps

physical_findings: Painful inflammation of the area between the earlobe and the angle of the mandible (parotitis)
Red and swollen mucosa of the Stensen duct
Involvement of the submaxillary and submandibular glands

Urine mumps virus.abnormal_range: Presence of mumps virus in urine during the first five days of parotitis in 72% of cases

risk_factors: Living in a crowded or close-knit setting

required: Clinical observation of symptoms consistent with mumps
Laboratory testing confirming mumps infection (e.g., presence of mumps virus in urine)
